item.title: Angular 4 - Nested Routing
item.description: Applications are often separated in two parts. A home with the description of the application, the features, a pricing table etc.. And a second part that requires the users to log in with for example an admin panel, an overview and dashboards. Following the DRY principle, you should aim at having a template for the home and the main part of your website. The best way to achieve this is to have nested routes.
